fields.title: Introduction to this Thread
fields.content:
Hey, and welcome to the official XP tutorial.
Here you will learn how to successfully tailor XP to your server.
We'll also make XP easy to learn, so you can easily customize and add to your server in the future.

fields.title: Introduction to Prefixes
fields.content:
Prefixes are the set of characters in front of a command that tell XP that you want to execute one.

By default the prefix of XP is set to "{PREFIX}", but you can also simply mark XP to execute a command.

fields.title: Customization
fields.content:
```md
{PREFIX}prefix <your_new_prefix>```

fields.title: Introduction to Modules
fields.content:
XP is divided into a few easy to understand modules to turn functions on or off.

e.g. the module "MessageXP" controls if members get XP by writing messages in the server, while the "Autonick" module controls if the levels of the users are displayed in their nicknames.

fields.title: Customization
fields.content:
```md
> List the current modules and settings
{PREFIX}modules

> Switch the setting of a module
{PREFIX}module <module>```

fields.title: Introduction to Values
fields.content:
Just like modules, values allow you to customize XP to your server and application.

Values, unlike modules, do not control functions, but the values that are distributed or used to make the functions work as they are supposed to.

For example, with the Values system we can set how much XP a member gets per message, how long cooldowns last between messages, how levels voice chat sessions are calculated, ...

fields.title: Customization
fields.content:
```md
> List all currently set values
{PREFIX}values

> Set a value 
{PREFIX}value <value_name> <new_amount>```

fields.title: Introduction to Logging
fields.content: The loggers allow you to easily set channels where you want to receive messages like level up notices from XP.

fields.title: Customization
fields.content:
```md
> List every available logger
{PREFIX}logging

> Assign a Channel to a logger
{PREFIX}logging <logger> <#TextChannel>

> Revmove an assigned logger
{PREFIX}logging <logger>```

fields.title: Introduction to Announcements
fields.content: Announcements allow you to have XP notify you and your members when a user has reached a level. Announcements can be completely customized to your server and allow you to ping members.

fields.title: Where will my Announcements be printed
fields.content: Announcements are sent either in the "current"-channel mode or in a previously set logger.

fields.title: How to setup a custom message
fields.content:
Announcement messages can be created by yourself without any problems using the commands below. You only need the following attributes:
```md
> Use the following attributes
{TAG} • e.g. Clyde#0000
{MNT} • e.g. @Clyde
{LVL} • e.g. 233
{CMB} • e.g. 2```

fields.title: Customization
fields.content:
```md
> Every usage can be found here:
{PREFIX}help announce```

fields.title: Introduction to Level Roles
fields.content: Level roles give you the ability to automatically assign a role to members for reaching a certain level.

fields.title: For Example
fields.content: If a user reaches level 150 and you have created a _**Cool Special People**_ role for level 150, this user will receive this and all previous roles.

fields.title: Usage
fields.content:
```md
> List all currently set roles
{PREFIX}roles

> Add a level role 
{PREFIX}role set <@role> <level>

> Remove a level role 
{PREFIX}role remove <level>```

fields.title: Introduction to Boosted Roles
fields.content: Boosted roles can be used to increase the xp rewards of certain users. Any user who has a boosted role will receive the correspondingly higher xp rewards.

fields.title: For Example
fields.content: If a User has a boosted role with 25% and another with 10%, any of their XP payouts will be increased by 35%.

fields.title: Usage
fields.content:
```md
> List all currently set roles
{PREFIX}roles

> Add a boosted role 
{PREFIX}role boost set <@role> <boost_percentage>

> Remove a boosted role 
{PREFIX}role boost remove <@role>```

fields.title: Standard Games
fields.content: Games like "roll", "loot" or "fish" allow you to earn small amounts of xp by repeatedly playing games of chance. Games can be played every 2 minutes.

fields.title: Party Games
fields.content: A party allows you to play all three games "roll", "loot" and "fish" at the same time with your friends and compete with them.

fields.title: Usage
fields.content:
```md
{PREFIX}roll
{PREFIX}loot
{PREFIX}fish

{PREFIX}party
> Let only the winner get the reward
{PREFIX}party "luck"
```

fields.title: Introduction to Manual XP Editing
fields.content: You can of course control your members' xp accounts manually. For example, you can easily set the level of a user or add or remove someone's xp.

fields.title: Usage
fields.content:
```md
{PREFIX}addxp <@Member> <xp>
{PREFIX}removexp <@Member> <xp>
{PREFIX}setxp <@Member> <xp>
{PREFIX}setlevel <@Member> <level>```
